packet sniffer will show if the firewall is rejecting

Selected Answer: D
Packet sniffer is the answer. The better of the answer.

If the problem is suspected with the firewall why would you use a tool to query the domain name system? furthermore, if users are able to get to it from the outside wouldn't that suggest that DNS is working? I believe the answer should be D: Packet sniffer. You can analyze the traffic to see where the packets are being dropped.

questions.question_text: A network technician is assisting a user who is having problems accessing a particular website. Other users are reporting that the website is accessible outside of the office. The technician suspects the problem is with the company's firewall. Which of the following should the technician use to troubleshoot?

discussion.content:
POP3 (110) and IMAP (143) for receive email
SMTP (25) for sending email

SMTP can be used to both send and receive mail. Post Office Protocol version
3 (POP3) and Internet Message Access Protocol version 4 (IMAP4) can be
used only to receive mail.
Interesting, while it is true that SMTP is used to receive and send e-mail, I think that because the question asks about configuring the e-mail "client", then POP and IMAP should be your two choices.

questions.question_text: Which of the following protocols are used to configure an email client to receive email? (Choose two.)
A network extension needs to be run to a location 500ft (152m) from the nearest switch. Which of the following solutions would work BEST? (Choose two.)

discussion.content: Remember cat 7 is always STP and still not certified for good practices
Cat6 distance max is 100 meter but pay attention it says with repeater in the middle

comments.content: Naw man, each of these are independent solutions, so you can either run fiber which has longer cable limits or use a repeater to have a cat cable run longer than 100m.

discussion.content: how can we use cat 6 fiber optic cabling? Surely answer would be A and C???
Shouldn't cat 7 with a repeater be the answer? since cat 6 has a max distance of 55 meters you would need at least 2 repeaters to cover the 152m

comments.content:
The maximum cabling length of Cat6 network cable is 100 m. and the option for a CAT7 with a repeater is not given only 
https://medium.com/@fsjoanna/cat6-vs-cat7-cable-which-is-optimum-for-a-new-house-a9240408efe5
Had they mentioned Ethernet speed of 10 gig, then cat 6a (55m lenght) would be the cable used and therefore too short.

choices.A: Cat 6 with a repeater placed in the middle of the run
choices.E: Cat 7 with a patch panel placed in the middle of the run

questions.question_text: A network administrator wants to connect to a remote device via SSH. Which of the following layers of the OSI model is the protocol using?

discussion.content: The SSH protocol is apart of Layer 7: The Application Layer. SSH, is an OSI model application layer protocol use cryptographic to allow remote login and other network services to operate securely over an unsecured network.
So, if I understand this correcting SSH is an application layer protocol that communicates on port 22 via TCP?
Port 22 is what SSH runs on.?

comments.content:
Yes it runs on port 22.
No it operates at layer 7, like most applications.

discussion.content:
In Mike Meyers Book:
Many multilayer switches handle load balancing by functioning at multiple
layers. An alternative is a content switch. Content switches always work at Layer
7 (Application layer). Content switches designed to work with Web servers, for
example, can read incoming HTTP and HTTPS requests. With this, you can
perform very advanced actions, such as handling SSL certificates and cookies,
on the content switch, removing the workload from the Web servers. Not only
can these devices load balance in the ways previously described, but their HTTP
savvy can actually pass a cookie to HTTP requesters—Web browsers—so the
next time that client returns, it is sent to the same server.
The CompTIA Network+ exam refers to a content switch as a content filter network appliance.

Thus answer "Content Filter" sounds fine to me.

comments.content: maybe this question was made when there were no virtual UTMs available. haha

anyway! 
The company is small. A virtual UTM is usually used in a large organisation
virtual UTM's are available all over the place !!

discussion.content: A virtual web content filtering appliance , UTM not virtual ,
Content Filter because nothing else fits the requirement
Answer is correct its for Webserver - Content filter for applications works on layer 7

Virtual UTM is most popular among small companies because virtual UTM gives a reasonable option of acquiring every security solution independently. 

https://cdome.comodo.com/virtual-utm.php
Reverse proxy isn't part of a content filter! Really starting to question this website.
UTM has a DMZ?

comments.content: yes refer to Sophos UTM doc or any other UTM's

discussion.content: UTM includes functions such as anti-virus, anti-spam, content filtering, and web filtering.
The correct answer should be D. A UTM can act as a proxy, a content filter can't.

questions.question_text: A small company has decided to use a single virtual appliance to filter spam as well as reverse proxy and filter traffic to its internal web server. Which of the following has the company MOST likely deployed?
